Sentencas: The La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+delta (y = 0.0-0.4) nickelates, synthesized via a solid-state reaction method, are investigated as prospective materials for oxygen permeation membranes and IT-SOFC cathodes.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The obtained oxides are single-phase and possess a tetragonal structure (I4/mmm sp. gr.).
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The unit cell parameter c and the cell volume increase with Cu-substitution.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The interstitial oxygen content and total conductivity decrease with Cu-substitution.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The low concentration of mobile interstitial oxygen ions results in a limited oxygen permeability of Cu-substituted La1.7Ca0.3NiO4+delta ceramic membranes.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, increasing the Cu content over y = 0.2 induces two beneficial effects: enhancement of the electrochemical activity of the La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+delta (y = 0.0; 0.2; 0.4) electrodes and decreasing the sintering temperature from 1200 degrees C to 900 degrees C. Enhanced electrode activity is due to better sintering properties of the developed materials ensuring excellent adhesion and facilitating the charge transfer at the electrode/electrolyte interface and, probably, faster oxygen exchange in Cu-rich materials.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The polarization resistance of the La1.7Ca0.3Ni1.6Cu0.4O4+delta electrode on the Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 electrolyte is as low as 0.15 omega cm(2) and 1.95 omega cm(2) at 850 degrees C and 700 degrees C in air, respectively.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The results of the present work demonstrate that the developed La1.7Ca0.3Ni0.6Cu0.4O4+delta-based electrode can be considered as a potential cathode for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Development of La1.7Ca0.3Ni1-yCuyO4+δ Materials for Oxygen Permeation Membranes and Cathodes for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
